name: Makki Ki Roti
history: Makki Ki Roti is a traditional North Indian flatbread, particularly famous in the Punjab region. It is commonly made during winter and is an integral part of Punjabi cuisine, often paired with Sarson Ka Saag.
description: Makki Ki Roti is a flatbread made from maize flour, known as 'makki' in Hindi. It is a gluten-free bread with a distinct yellow color and rich, grainy texture. Makki Ki Roti is usually cooked on a tawa and can be enjoyed with butter or ghee.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: In a bowl, mix maize flour and salt. Gradually add warm water and knead into a soft dough. Let it rest for a few minutes.

instructions.title: Roll and Cook the Rotis
instructions.description: Divide the dough into small balls. Roll each ball between sheets of plastic or with a rolling pin into a flat, round shape. Cook on a hot griddle, applying ghee or butter, until both sides have golden brown spots.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the hot Makki Ki Roti with Sarson Ka Saag, butter, or yogurt.

tips: The dough should be soft and pliable for easy rolling.
Cooking on medium heat ensures even cooking without burning.
variations: Add spices like carom seeds or chopped fenugreek leaves for extra flavor.
Try making stuffed Makki Ki Roti with spiced vegetables or paneer.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh but can be stored in an airtight container for up to 24 hours.
storage.instructions: Reheat on a griddle before serving if stored.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a hot griddle or tawa until warm and soft.
presentationTips: Serve on a traditional thali for an authentic look.
Pair with pickles, chutneys, and a fresh salad for a complete meal.
